reference.shortdesc: An XML element is the basic building block of an XML document. It can contain text, other elements, processing instructions, and more.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The content of the xmlelement element should be the element type name without leading or trailing angle brackets.

section.title: Rendering expectations
section.p: The contents of the xmlelement element is typically rendered with leading (<) and trailing (>) angle brackets.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The xmlelement element is specialized from markupname; the xmlelement element is defined in the XML-mention domain module. The markupname element is specialized from keyword, and the markupname element is defined in the markup-name domain module.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows how the xmlelement element can be used to tag the uicontrol element from the user-interface domain.
example.codeblock: Use the uicontrol element to indicate the names of buttons, entry fields, menu items, or other objects that enable a user to interact with a graphical user interface.
